prompt: Please give me a list of 10 inspiring, motivational, or otherwise interesting quotes. Be sure to include the author, the date it was written or said (only if known), its source (such as a book or published work, only if known), and a 1-sentence commentary on the quote to give it some more context and relevance.
response:
Here are 10 inspiring, motivational, or interesting quotes for you:

1. "The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams." - Eleanor Roosevelt, 1940
2. Commentary: This quote emphasizes the power of belief and optimism in achieving one's goals and realizing one's dreams.

3. "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." - Oscar Wilde, 1889 
4. Commentary: This quote encourages individuals to embrace their unique qualities and avoid imitating others, as being authentic is a rare and valuable trait.

5. "The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today." - Franklin D. Roosevelt, 1933
6. Commentary: This quote highlights the importance of confidence and self-belief in overcoming obstacles and achieving success.

7. "A person who never made a mistake never tried anything new." - Albert Einstein, no date specified 
8. Commentary: This quote suggests that making mistakes is an inevitable part of growth and learning, and that avoiding risks will prevent personal development.

9. "Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts." - Winston Churchill, 1942
10. Commentary: This quote emphasizes the importance of perseverance and resilience in the face of both success and failure, as these qualities are essential for long-term achievement.

11. "The only way to do great work is to love what you do." - Steve Jobs, 2005 
12. Commentary: This quote highlights the significance of passion and enthusiasm in pursuing excellence and achieving remarkable results.

13. "We must be willing to let go of the life we planned so as to have the life that is waiting for us." - Joseph Campbell, 1949
14. Commentary: This quote encourages individuals to embrace change and adaptability, as these qualities are necessary for discovering and fulfilling one's true purpose.

15. "The only thing we have to fear is... fear itself." - Franklin D. Roosevelt, 1933
16. Commentary: This quote suggests that the greatest obstacle to success and growth is often our own fears and doubts, which can be overcome through courage and self-belief.

prompt: Please give me a list of 10 inspiring, motivational, or otherwise interesting quotes. Be sure to include the author, the date it was written or said (only if known), its source (such as a book or published work, only if known), and a 1-sentence commentary on the quote to give it some more context and relevance.
response:
Here are 10 inspiring, motivational quotes along with their relevant information:

1. "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." - Mahatma Gandhi, 1940s
   Commentary: This quote encourages personal responsibility for creating a better world through our own actions and choices.

2. "The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today." - Franklin D. Roosevelt, March 27, 1939
   Commentary: This quote emphasizes the importance of self-belief and confidence in achieving future goals and aspirations.

3. "It is neither good nor bad but thinking makes it so." - William Shakespeare, Hamlet (1600-1601)
   Commentary: This quote highlights the power of our thoughts in shaping our perception of events and situations.

4. "The best way to predict the future is to create it." - Abraham Lincoln
   Commentary: This quote stresses the importance of taking action and being proactive in shaping one's life and future.

5. "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." - Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray (1890-1900)
   Commentary: This quote encourages authenticity and embracing one's unique qualities rather than conforming to societal norms.

6. "The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall." - Nelson Mandela
   Commentary: This quote emphasizes resilience and the ability to bounce back from setbacks as key to success and personal growth.

7. "Two roads diverged in a wood, and I—I took the one less traveled by, And that has made all the difference." - Robert Frost, The Road Not Taken (1916)
   Commentary: This quote celebrates the courage to make unconventional choices and the impact they can have on our lives.

8. "I attribute my success to this: I never gave or took any advice." - Mark Twain, Pudd'nhead Wilson's New Calendar (1897)
   Commentary: This quote highlights the value of self-reliance and personal decision-making in achieving success.

9. "Life is what you make it, always has been, always will be." - Jack Lemon as Charlie Chaplin in The Great Dictator (1940)
   Commentary: This quote emphasizes the power of our choices and actions in shaping our life's journey and experience.

10. "The only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle." - Steve Jobs, Stanford University Commencement Address (2005)
    Commentary: This quote encourages pursuing a career or passion that brings joy and fulfillment, rather than settling for something less fulfilling.
